chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Magdalena Luz Montalvo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prostitution-Sexual Gratification, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by the end of probation period in case 13CF5060. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

FORTHWITH. Credit for 8 days time served.
Consecutive to: to any sentence. Court allowed defendant to have work release, and release to participate in any programming at the House of Correction. Court allowed release at the discretion of the House of Correction regarding court-ordered programming corresponding to Chapter 48. Court will allow defendant release to either the Day Reporting Center or the Meta House.
Court ordered the defendant to obey all Childrens Court orders.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Magdalena Luz Montalvo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Magdalena Luz Montalvo in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing. Parties are ready to proceed. Statements made as to sentencing. 

As to COUNT 2 as AMENDED-
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any sentence; forthwith; credit for 8 days time served.

Court allowed defendant to have work release, and release to participate in any programming at the House of Correction. Court allowed release at the discretion of the House of Correction regarding court-ordered programming corresponding to Chapter 48. Court will allow defendant release to either the Day Reporting Center or the Meta House.

Court ordered the defendant to obey all Childrens Court orders. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by the end of probation period in case 13CF5060. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Filed;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Letter from Meta House on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant sworn.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 25.

Defendant Magdalena Luz Montalvo in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to PROSTITUTION contrary to Wis. Stats. Sec. 944.30(2), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Magdalena Luz Montalvo in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Parties have reached a resolution and request a plea date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 06/30/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Cover letter and State's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's List of Witnesses received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Magdalena Luz Montalvo in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. State and defense counsel to file witness lists, motions in limine, and jury instructions by 04/25/2014 at 12:00 p.m. Parties are ready to proceed to trial. Discussion regarding State's motion for dual juries. Defense does not object. Court GRANTS State's motion for dual juries. Case will be scheduled for motion hearing on same date as co-defendant's case to keep the cases together although Attorney Schwarz has not filed any motions in this matter. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 06/30/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
for Empaneling Dual Juries, recieved and filed.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  
State's motion to consolidate, argued.  Court grants the State's motion, in part, and ordered this case consolidated with defendant's lower pending case 13CF5060 for trial. 
Case adjourned for jury trial and final pretrial in Br 25.
Defendant to Comply with all conditions of signature bond and Written No Contact Order.
No unsupervised contact with KTM.  Defendant to comply with Ch. 48 actions and orders.

Defendant Magdalena Luz Montalvo in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25, due to lower pending case.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant advised of maximum penalties.  Jury trial scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance in Room 502 Safety Building on 2/11/14 @ 8:30am
